meanings.definition: To harness or yoke oxen or horses to a wagon or plow.
meanings.sent1: The farmer inspanned the horses to the plow to prepare the field for planting.
meanings.sent2: They inspanned the oxen to the wagon to transport the heavy load.
meanings.sent3: The children inspanned their imagination to create a magical world in their backyard.
meanings.sent4: She inspanned her determination to overcome the obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The team inspanned their efforts to achieve victory in the championship game.

meanings.definition: To enlist or recruit for a specific purpose.
meanings.sent1: The general inspanned new soldiers to join the army and defend the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: She inspanned volunteers to help clean up the park after the storm.
meanings.sent3: The teacher inspanned the students to participate in the science fair with exciting experiments.
meanings.sent4: He inspanned his friends to support him in his quest for a healthier lifestyle.
meanings.sent5: The organization inspanned dedicated individuals to work towards a common goal of environmental conservation.
